StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Demographically Diverse Substance Use Disorder Cohorts of Dr. Stanley H. Weiss

StudyType22.name: other_molecular
StudyType22.other_value: the lllumina Infinium OmniExpress-24 V1.3 BeadChip, with 714,238 SNPs probed

Person.Organization: UNIV OF MED/DENT OF NJ-NJ MEDICAL SCHOOLRBHS-NEW JERSEY MEDICAL SCHOOL

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The suggested Acknowledgement Statement to accompany the dataset is: “The Demographically Diverse Substance Use Disorder Cohorts of Dr. Stanley H. Weiss’s data and samples are the product of research by Stanley H. Weiss, MD and colleagues, based upon a series of prospective cohort projects led by Dr. Weiss, the principal investigator, which were initiated in the 1980s, funded in part by the National Cancer Institute, the National Institute on Drug Abuse, the New Jersey Department of Health, the University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey, and Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey. The SNP genotyping data are supported by a contract from the National Institute on Drug Abuse for the support of the NIDA Genetics Consortium, of which Dr. Weiss is a member, and for which the current project officer is Jonathan D. Pollock, PhD. As of 2018, Dr. Weiss is at the Rutgers New Jersey Medical School in Newark, New Jersey. Specific journal and other citations are available upon request to Dr. Weiss.”
Policy.ic_specific_access_term:
Approved Users acknowledge the NIH’s expectation that they will not submit findings using the “Demographically Diverse Substance Use Disorder Cohorts of Dr. Stanley H. Weiss” dataset(s), or updated versions thereof, for publication or presentation for a period of exclusivity for Contributing Investigators concluding with the Embargo Date identified on the dbGaP or other NIH genomic data repository homepage.
Data use is limited to Health/Medical/Biomedical Research
Requestor agrees to make results of studies using data available to the larger scientific community.
For non-profit use only.

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (IRB, PUB, NPU)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-IRB-PUB-NPU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.
